overview_summary: All five profiled landowners have no documented public stance on the development (0 support, 0 oppose, 5 unknown). None hold formal civic positions; in fact, no neighbors here are considered high-influence community figures, reflecting generally private, long-time local residents.

neighbors.name: Kenneth Helton & Neoma Linares
neighbors.claims: Neoma Linares (born 1945 in Altus) later relocated to Texas ([www.legacy.com](https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/name/neoma-linares-obituary?id=59841877#:~:text=Neoma%20Lee%20Linares%2C%20a%20beloved,in%20family%20values%20and%20faith)) ([www.legacy.com](https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/name/neoma-linares-obituary?id=59841877#:~:text=Neoma%20is%20survived%20by%20her,is%20also%20survived%20by%20her)). She and co-owner Kenneth Helton do not appear in any local civic records or news reports, suggesting no public-facing roles as of 2025.

approach_recommendations.engage: Connect via shared local heritage; acknowledge their family’s long history in the area to build rapport.

neighbors.name: Annette & George Benbow
neighbors.claims: Annette and George Benbow are listed as landowners in Headrick with no identifiable presence in news archives or public meeting records (no mentions found as of 2025), indicating they maintain a low public profile. Their lack of public commentary or roles means no clear stance or influence could be determined from available records.

approach_recommendations.engage: Outreach should be personal and low-key. Engage through informal channels (e.g., mutual neighbors) to respect their privacy.

neighbors.name: Betty L. Walls
neighbors.claims: Betty L. Walls appears to be part of a local farming family; for example, a Rance Walls received USDA farm program payments in Jackson County ([southkcnews.com](https://southkcnews.com/stories/655139236-how-much-in-taxpayer-funded-subsidies-did-farmers-in-jackson-county-receive-in-2021#:~:text=Rance%20Walls%20%20,Targeted)). There is no record of Betty holding any public office or making statements on development in local sources, implying her stance remains unrecorded.

approach_recommendations.engage: Highlight respect for agricultural land and reassure on preserving farm operations. A farm community liaison (like a fellow farmer) could best initiate dialogue.

neighbors.name: Gregory K. & Julie M. Carpenter
neighbors.claims: Gregory and Julie Carpenter are part of a multi-generational farm family in Jackson County. A Carpenter Family Trust in the county received Conservation Reserve Program payments ([southkcnews.com](https://southkcnews.com/stories/655139236-how-much-in-taxpayer-funded-subsidies-did-farmers-in-jackson-county-receive-in-2021#:~:text=Carpenter%20Family%20Trust%20%20,%246%2C522)), and a James V. Carpenter obtained livestock assistance ([southkcnews.com](https://southkcnews.com/stories/655139236-how-much-in-taxpayer-funded-subsidies-did-farmers-in-jackson-county-receive-in-2021#:~:text=James%20V.%20Carpenter%20%20,%2449%2C437)) – reflecting the family’s agricultural engagement. No public meeting records or statements were found for the Carpenters, suggesting they have kept a low civic profile.
neighbors.influence_justification: Established farm family; no public role

approach_recommendations.engage: Recognize their conservation efforts (e.g., land in CRP) and long family ties. Engage via agricultural extension or farm bureau contacts they trust to discuss the project’s benefits to land stewardship.

neighbors.name: Justin Tanner Carpenter
neighbors.claims: Justin Tanner Carpenter is likely part of the same Carpenter farming family in the area (sharing surname and land proximity). The Carpenter family’s presence is noted through subsidy records (e.g., a family trust’s conservation payments ([southkcnews.com](https://southkcnews.com/stories/655139236-how-much-in-taxpayer-funded-subsidies-did-farmers-in-jackson-county-receive-in-2021#:~:text=Carpenter%20Family%20Trust%20%20,%246%2C522))), but Justin himself has no documented public statements or roles. His personal stance on development is not recorded in any available public sources.
neighbors.influence_justification: Family farm member; no public role

approach_recommendations.engage: Frame discussions around maintaining productive farmland and respecting family farming continuity. A younger local farmer or peer could be a relatable messenger.
